headline: Trump's Fears About Liz Cheney Race May Be Coming True
author: Jon Jackson
sentences: She has also publicly countered his unproven claims that the 2020 presidential election was stolen from him, and she drew more ire from his supporters by accepting a vice-chair position on the House select committee investigating the Capitol riot.

The New York Times reported she not only opposed her party in naming Trump as its presidential nominee at the 2016 Republican National Convention, but she also referred to him as "racist" and "xenophobic."
However, Cheney's campaign war chest and the fact that several other GOP candidates are vying for the nominationin addition to the one endorsed by Trumpmay aid Cheney's path to re-election.
Politico reported that Cheney's campaign will soon announce that it has raised $2.94 million in the first quarter of 2022, which will bring her total to over $10 million.
The substantial amount of money raised by her campaign gives the congresswoman a financial advantage over her opponents in the upcoming GOP primary race for her seat.
The news of her fundraising figures comes as former President Donald Trump's strategy of uniting his supporters behind one challenger to defeat Cheney is in jeopardy.
Cheney was the highest-ranking Republican to vote to impeach Trump in January 2021 over allegations that he played a role in inciting the riot on the U.S. Capitol.
Wyoming Republican Representative Liz Cheney raised a personal fundraising record of $2.94 million for the first quarter of 2022, according to a Monday report.
